Needing a pistol to replace the Russian-made PM, Ukraine created the Fort-12. A formidable weapon largely considered a success, though it falls short when compared to the reliability of the PM. Fortunately, the Fort-12 more than makes up for it in accuracy, magazine size and ergonomics.

The latest development of the Ukrainian state owned FORT factory, the Fort-17 is a polymer framed modification of the earlier Fort-12 pistol. All mechanisms and properties are almost identical between the two pistols, however the Fort-17 is much lighter than its predecessor.

A copy of the Jericho 941 based on the highly regarded CZ-75 short recoil system, the Fort-21, like the Jericho 941, combines proven design and function with IWI’s exceptionally high standards for reliable performance, accuracy and quality construction.
